DISCUSSION...A LINE OF STRONG/SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS EXTENDING FROM CENTRAL IL INTO NORTHERN IND WILL SAG SOUTHEASTWARD THIS EVENING ACROSS THE WATCH AREA.  STRONG INSTABILITY COUPLED WITH SUFFICIENT FLOW ALOFT WILL MAINTAIN A RISK OF LOCALLY DAMAGING WINDS IN THE STRONGER STORMS.

DISCUSSION...FAST-MOVING BOW ECHO OVER NORTHERN INDIANA WILL RACE EASTWARD DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS.  WIDESPREAD DAMAGING WINDS WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE...ALTHOUGH RECENT RADAR AND LIGHTNING TRENDS SUGGEST THE SYSTEM HAS WEAKENED SLIGHTLY.  AMPLE MOISTURE AND STRONG INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE STORMS MAY RE-INTENSIFY THE BOW OVER OH.

DISCUSSION...LINE OF SVR TSTMS HAS DEVELOPED OVER LE.  WITH 40-50KT OF WLY FLOW JUST OFF SURFACE ALONG WITH A MOIST/MODESTLY UNSTABLE AND MIXED AIR MASS WILL SUPPORT A WIND DAMAGE THREAT AS THESE STORMS MOVE RAPIDLY EWD ACROSS THE WATCH.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE/STRENGTH OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS ALONG AND AHEAD OF DIFFUSE COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED UPR IMPULSE MOVING RAPIDLY E ACROSS THE LWR GRT LKS. LARGELY UNIDIRECTIONAL MEAN WLY FLOW AOA 40 KTS /50-60 KTS AT 500 MB/ AND LACK OF STRONG LOW LVL CONVERGENCE SUGGEST LIKELIHOOD FOR SCTD SUPERCELLS.  THESE MAY ORGANIZE INTO SHORT BANDS/BROKEN LINES. ATTENDANT BOWING SEGMENTS MAY YIELD SWATHS OF DMGG WIND AND PERHAPS A BRIEF TORNADO OR TWO GIVEN INCREASING LOW LVL INSTABILITY.

summary: DISCUSSION...SVR THREAT INCREASING ALONG/AHEAD OF COLD FRONT CORRESPONDING TO RECENT INCREASE IN MULTICELLULAR/LINEAR DEVELOPMENT...PER MESOSCALE DISCUSSION 1110.  POTENTIAL EXPECTED TO BECOME BETTER ORGANIZED AS FOREGOING AIR MASS CONTINUES TO DESTABILIZE BENEATH SRN RIM OF FAVORABLE DEEP-LAYER FLOW.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INCREASING ALONG DIFFUSE COLD FRONT NOW BISECTING PA.  OTHER STORMS MAY FORM AHEAD OF FRONT ALONG LEE TROUGH.  STRENGTH OF DEEP UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND FIELD AND CONTINUED LOW LVL DESTABILIZATION LIKELY WILL LEAD TO INCREASED POTENTIAL FOR DMGG WIND GUSTS AS STORMS...INCLUDING A FEW SUPERCELLS...ORGANIZE INTO SHORT LINE/BANDS.

DISCUSSION...FRONTAL AND PRE-FRONTAL TSTMS NOW INCREASING IN FAST WLY FLOW ON S SIDE OF ST LAWRENCE VLY UPR VORT SHOULD CONTINUE E INTO WW AREA LATER THIS AFTN.  40-50 KT DEEP WLY SHEAR AND TERRAIN-GENERATED BOUNDARIES SHOULD SUPPORT A FEW SUSTAINED STORMS/SUPERCELLS.  THESE COULD YIELD A FEW SWATHS OF DMGG WIND/MARGINALLY SVR HAIL.  A CONDITIONAL RISK ALSO WILL EXIST FOR A TORNADO OR TWO IN AREAS WHERE TERRAIN INFLUENCES/LOW LVL BOUNDARY SEGMENTS KEEP LOW LVL FLOW SLIGHTLY BACKED...MOST LIKELY IN MAINE.

DISCUSSION...STRONG/SVR COLD FRONTAL TSTMS NOW OVER THE WV MOUNTAINS EXPECTED TO MOVE/DEVELOP GENERALLY ESE THROUGH AT LEAST EARLY EVE. WHILE DEEP WNWLY SHEAR DIMINISHES WITH SWD EXTENT...WEAKLY CONVERGENT PRE-FRONTAL FLOW...PRESENCE OF TCU OVER AND E OF THE MOUNTAINS ...AND STEEP LOW LVL LAPSE RATE ENVIRONMENT E OF THE MOUNTAINS SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR DMGG WIND GUSTS AND PERHAPS MARGINALLY SVR HAIL.

DISCUSSION...WAA TSTMS EXPECTED TO BECOME STRONGER AND MORE NEARLY SFC-BASED LATER THIS AFTN AS WAA PRESISTS AND POSSIBLY ATOP SHALLOW WNW-ESE FRONTAL ZONE.  ASCENT ALSO MAY BE ENHANCED BY DIRECT CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH ENTRANCE REGION OF UPR JET STREAK IN WRN ONT.  DEEP SHEAR WILL REMAIN MODEST...BUT WITH A SUBSTANTIAL DIRECTIONAL COMPONENT.  AND...MOISTURE...WHILE NOT PARTICULARLY RICH...WILL BE ADEQUATE FOR SUSTAINED STORMS.  OVERLL SETUP THEREFORE APAPERAS SUPPORTIVE OF A FEW STORMS/POSSIBLE SUPERCELLS WITH LARGE HAIL AND LOCALLY DMGG WIND.

DISCUSSION...ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO WESTERN NORTH DAKOTA THIS EVENING FROM THE WEST/NORTH AND SPREAD ACROSS THE WATCH AREA.  ALTHOUGH STORMS WILL BE WIDELY SCATTERED...POTENTIAL WILL EXIST FOR SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO INTENSIFY THIS AFTERNOON OVER PORTIONS OF ND/SD IN REGION OF MOIST AND VERY UNSTABLE AIRMASS.  PRIMARY FOCI FOR INITIATION WILL BE MULTIPLE WEAK LOW LEVEL BOUNDARIES IN REGION OF WEAK CINH.  MODERATE EFFECTIVE SHEAR WILL PROMOTE SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...SVR TSTM POTENTIAL FCST TO INCREASE RAPIDLY OVER WRN/CENTRAL PORTIONS OF WW AREA THROUGH REMAINDER AFTERNOON...EXPANDING/SPREADING EWD.  INITIALLY SUPERCELLULAR CONVECTIVE MODE MAY TRANSITION UPSCALE TO DAMAGING MCS...PER MESOSCALE DISCUSSION 1123.

DISCUSSION...MULTIPLE CLUSTERS OF INTENSE THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTHERN MN ARE EXPECTED TO ACCELERATE SOUTHEASTWARD INTO WESTERN WI AND NORTHEAST IA DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS.  A FAST-MOVING BOW ECHO IS POSSIBLE WITH THE RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS AND HAIL.

DISCUSSION...LINE OF STRONG/SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE MN/IA BORDER WILL SAG SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE LATE EVENING INTO A VERY MOIST/UNSTABLE AIRMASS.  A FEW EMBEDDED STORMS WILL REMAIN CAPABLE OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS FOR ANOTHER SEVERAL HOURS.

DISCUSSION...ELEVATED SUPERCELL WAS LOCATED IN SERN SD EAST OF HURON. THIS STORM IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TRACKING EWD ALONG E-W ORIENTED WARM FRONT AND EVENTUALLY BECOME SURFACE BASED. ONCE THIS STORM IS ABLE TO TAP INTO THE BOUNDARY LAYER...ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS WILL BE VERY FAVORABLE FOR THIS STORM TO PRODUCE VERY LARGE HAIL ...DAMAGING WINDS AS WELL AS TORNADOES. LATER THIS AFTERNOON...OTHER SUPERCELLS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP NEAR THE WARM FRONT AND EAST OF SURFACE LOW IN SERN SD...WITH VERY LARGE HAIL...WIND DAMAGE AND A FEW TORNADOES ALSO LIKELY.
DISCUSSION...AS UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES REGION...THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE IN COVERAGE. STRONG INSTABILITY AND 40 KT SHEAR WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR A FEW SUPERCELLS WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...STEADY INCREASE IN TSTM COVERAGE AND IN ACCOMPANYING SVR POTENTIAL IS EXPECTED OVER REMAINDER MID-LATE AFTERNOON...ON BOTH SIDES OF COLD FRONT SLATED TO MOVE EWD ACROSS WW AREA. GREATEST SHEAR/BUOYANCY JUXTAPOSITION SHOULD REMAIN E OF CONFLUENCE LINE OVER ERN ND...AS PER MESOSCALE DISCUSSION 1134...HOWEVER LARGE HAIL ALSO IS POSSIBLE WITH POST-FRONTAL TSTMS.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO RAPIDLY INTENSIFY THIS AFTERNOON OVER NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL NEB AND MOVE EASTWARD THROUGH THE EVENING ACROSS THE WATCH AREA.  EXTREMELY MOIST AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS COMBINED WITH SUFFICIENT EFFECTIVE SHEAR WILL PROMOTE THE RISK OF SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF VERY LARGE HAIL...DAMAGING WINDS...AND ISOLATED TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...LINE OF INTENSE THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTHERN MN AND NORTHWEST IA WILL TRACK SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE WATCH AREA THIS EVENING.  STRONG INSTABILITY AND SUFFICIENT FLOW ALOFT...COUPLED WITH INCREASING MESOSCALE ORGANIZATION OF STORMS...SUGGEST THE POTENTIAL FOR BOW ECHO FORMATION AND AN ASSOCIATED RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS.  LARGE HAIL IS ALSO POSSIBLE IN THE STRONGER CELLS.

DISCUSSION...INTENSE BOW ECHO OVER SOUTHERN MN/NORTHERN IA WILL TRACK QUICKLY EASTWARD INTO WESTERN WI DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS WITH POTENTIAL OF DAMAGING WINDS.  TRAILING LINE OF STORMS OVER IA WILL ALSO SPREAD EASTWARD INTO WATCH AREA...WITH RISK OF HAIL/WINDS AS WELL.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS ARE INTENSIFYING EARLY THIS MORNING ALONG AND AHEAD OF SFC FRONT WITHIN A VERY MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WITH MLCAPE OF 2000-2500 J/KG.  REGIONAL VWP/PROFILER DATA INDICATE A SWLY LLJ STRENGTHENING TO 40-50 KT WHICH SHOULD MAINTAIN AN INFLUX OF HIGH THETA-E AIR INTO GROWING STORMS.  MIDLEVEL WIND FIELD IS NOT PARTICULARLY STRONG...BUT THE PRESENCE OF THE STRONG LOW-LEVEL WINDS ATTENDANT TO LLJ AND DEGREE OF INSTABILITY SUGGEST THE POTENTIAL FOR UPSCALE GROWTH INTO A DAMAGING MCS.
areas: PART OF NORTHEAST AND EAST-CENTRAL NEBRASKA

summary: DISCUSSION...EVOLVING TSTM COMPLEX OVER WRN IA IS MOVING THROUGH A VERY MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WHERE MLCAPE REMAINS AROUND 2000-2500 J/KG.  MOREOVER...A 40-50 KT SWLY LLJ IS GRADUALLY MIGRATING EWD INTO THE REGION WHICH WILL SERVE TO ENHANCE INFLOW INTO TSTM CLUSTER.  AS SUCH...CONDITIONS APPEAR FAVORABLE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FORWARD-PROPAGATING SYSTEM WITH THE PRIMARY HAZARD BEING DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

summary: DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO INTENSIFY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS NW INDIANA AND SW LOWER MI IN ADVANCE OF AN MCV MOVING EWD FROM NRN IL...AND ALONG A REMNANT OUTFLOW BOUNDARY/SURFACE FRONT.  THE STORMS WILL THEN SPREAD EWD ACROSS LOWER MI TO NW OH BY MID-LATE AFTERNOON.  A BROAD CORRIDOR OF LOW-MID 70S BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS AND STRONG SURFACE HEATING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO WARM SECTOR MLCAPE VALUES OF 3000-4000 J/KG AHEAD OF THE STORMS...WHILE SOMEWHAT ENHANCED LOW-MIDLEVEL WLY FLOW WITH THE MCV WILL SUPPORT ORGANIZED MULTICELL CLUSTERS.  THERE WILL ALSO BE SOME THREAT FOR EMBEDDED SUPERCELL STRUCTURES NEAR THE FRONT ACROSS LOWER MI WHERE VERTICAL SHEAR WILL BE STRONGEST.  DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE PRIMARY SEVERE THREAT THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

DISCUSSION...SVR THREAT FCST TO SHIFT/EXPAND EWD FROM WW 423 AND FROM SRN ONT REGION ACROSS FAVORABLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS...UNDER SRN RIM OF FAVORABLE WLYS ALOFT AND RELATED DEEP-LAYER SHEAR...DURING REMAINDER AFTERNOON INTO EVENING.  REF SPC MESOSCALE DISCUSSION 1147 FOR INITIAL FCST DETAILS.

DISCUSSION...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE INCREASING IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY ACROSS MUCH OF MO AND CENTRAL IL...ALONG SEVERAL WEAK CONFLUENCE AXES.  A VERY MOIST/UNSTABLE AIRMASS AND RELATIVELY STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL PROMOTE WEAKLY ORGANIZED STORMS MOVING ACROSS THE WATCH AREA...CAPABLE OF GUSTY/DAMAGING WINDS AND HAIL.

DISCUSSION...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP IN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS IMMEDIATELY E OF THE HIGH TERRAIN...ALONG A DIFFERENTIAL HEATING BOUNDARY FROM NRN VA INTO SE PA.  SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE 90S TO THE E OF THE CLOUD BOUNDARY AND BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS OF 68-72 F ARE CONTRIBUTING TO MODERATE INSTABILITY...ALONG THE SRN FRINGE OF THE STRONGER MIDLEVEL FLOW/SHEAR.  THE MODERATE FLOW/INSTABILITY AND RELATIVELY DEEP SURFACE MIXED LAYER WILL SUPPORT DAMAGING GUSTS WITH ORGANIZED MULTICELL CLUSTERS...AND POTENTIALLY SOME EMBEDDED BOW/SUPERCELL STRUCTURES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON/EVENING AS STORMS APPROACH THE COAST.

DISCUSSION...DEEPENING CUMULUS CONVECTION IN VISIBLE IMAGERY AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE 90S ACROSS INTERIOR SRN NEW ENGLAND SUGGEST THAT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IS LIKELY WITHIN THE NEXT 1-2 HOURS.  GIVEN 35-45 KT WSWLY MIDLEVEL FLOW AND MODERATE INSTABILITY...ORGANIZED MULTICELL CLUSTERS AND EMBEDDED BOWS/SUPERCELLS WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING DAMAGING GUSTS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON/EVENING AS STORMS INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND SPREAD TOWARD THE COAST.

DISCUSSION...A CLUSTERING OF PULSE-TYPE SEVERE STORMS IS EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH FROM CENTRAL SC NEWD INTO ERN NC.  STRONG INSTABILITY AND A HOT/MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER...IN A WEAK VERTICAL SHEAR ENVIRONMENT...WILL FAVOR HYBRID MICROBURSTS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING DAMAGING WINDS.  THOUGH INDIVIDUAL STORMS WILL NOT LAST PARTICULARLY LONG...SOME GROWTH INTO SMALL CLUSTERS IS POSSIBLE THROUGH STORM/OUTFLOW MERGERS LATER THIS AFTERNOON.

DISCUSSION...WIDELY SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED IN THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS FROM NE ORE ACROSS CENTRAL ID INTO WRN MT.  THE CONVECTION WILL BE FOCUSED OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND IN THE VICINITY OF A BAROCLINIC ZONE ATTENDANT TO THE PAC NW MIDLEVEL TROUGH.  SURFACE OBSERVATIONS REVEAL TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE 80S ACROSS MUCH OF THIS AREA WITH DEWPOINTS HOLDING IN THE 50S...CONTRIBUTE TO MODERATE INSTABILITY /MLCAPE 1000-15000 J PER KG/.  MEANWHILE...A BELT OF 50-70 KT SWLY MIDLEVEL FLOW IS RESULTING IN EFFECTIVE BULK SHEAR IN EXCESS OF 50 KT AND RELATIVELY STRAIGHT HODOGRAPHS...WHICH WILL FAVOR SPLITTING SUPERCELLS AND THE POSSIBILITY OF SMALL BOWING SEGMENTS.  DAMAGING WINDS SHOULD BE THE PRIMARY SEVERE THREAT...THOUGH THE STEEP LAPSE RATES/MODERATE INSTABILITY WILL ALSO SUPPORT LARGE HAIL THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT.

DISCUSSION...HURRICANE ALEX CONTINUES TO MOVE TOWARD EXTREME NE MEXICO...LEAVING S TX IN THE RIGHT FRONT QUADRANT OF THE STORM CIRCULATION.  LOCAL VWP/S HAVE SHOWN AN INCREASE IN LOW-LEVEL FLOW/SHEAR OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS...AND EMBEDDED SUPERCELL STRUCTURES ARE TENDING TO SURVIVE CLOSER TO THE COAST WITH TIME IN THE BANDS N OF THE STORM CENTER.  GIVEN THE PRESENCE OF 77-80 F DEWPOINTS...SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY...AND INCREASING VERTICAL SHEAR...THE PROBABILITY OF A FEW TORNADOES WILL SLOWLY INCREASE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.
areas: THE LOWER AND MIDDLE TEXAS COAST

summary: DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE BEGINNING TO DEVELOP OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW MT AND ID...ALONG A BAROCLINIC ZONE AND BAND OF MODERATE SWLY FLOW ALOFT.  SURFACE HEATING IN THE WAKE OF EARLIER CONVECTION HAS RESULTED IN SUBSTANTIAL DESTABILIZATION...WITH MLCAPE NOW NEAR 1500 J/KG.  THIS INSTABILITY...COMBINED WITH STRAIGHT HODOGRAPHS AND EFFECTIVE BULK SHEAR NEAR 50 KT...WILL SUPPORT A FEW SUPERCELLS AND/OR SMALL BOWING SEGMENTS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL THROUGH THIS EVENING.
areas: PARTS OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN IDAHO

summary: DISCUSSION...STRONG/SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS OVER SOUTH CENTRAL MT AND EXTREME NORTH CENTRAL WY ARE LIKELY TO PROGRESS NEWD THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS ALONG THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF STRONGER FLOW ALOFT.  SWLY MID LEVEL WINDS OF 40-50 KT ARE CONTRIBUTING TO SUFFICIENT DEEP LAYER SHEAR TO ENHANCE STORM ORGANIZATION AND INTENSITY...WITH STORM ROTATION POSSIBLE IN STRONGER CELLS.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES IN EASTERN MT WHERE SURFACE DEW POINTS ARE IN THE MID/UPPER 50S SUPPORTING MLCAPE OF 1000-1500 J/KG...INDICATING SEVERE POTENTIAL WILL SPREAD NEWD WITH TIME.

DISCUSSION...CONVECTIVE BANDS ASSOCIATED WITH HURRICANE ALEX ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE MOVING WESTWARD ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHERN TX TONIGHT AS ALEX MOVES SLOWLY INLAND TONIGHT TO THE SOUTH OF BRO. 00Z BRO SOUNDING AND WSR-88D NEXRAD WIND PROFILES EXHIBIT VERY STRONG LOW LEVEL SHEAR AND HELICITY SUPPORTIVE OF MINIATURE SUPERCELLS AND AN ATTENDANT THREAT FOR A FEW TORNADOES TONIGHT.

DISCUSSION...STRONG/SEVERE STORMS OVER EXTREME SOUTHEAST MT HAVE SHOWN SIGNS OF DEVELOPING NWD WITH NEW UPDRAFTS...WHILE TRAILING STORMS TO THE WEST ARE SHOWING AN INCREASE IN CG LIGHTNING.  AIR MASS IN ADVANCE OF THE STORMS HAS BEEN MOISTENING/DESTABILIZING WITH SURFACE DEW POINTS IN THE UPPER 60S/LOWER 70S...CONTRIBUTING TO MLCAPE OF 2500 J/KG.  DEEP LAYER SHEAR IS SUPPORTIVE FOR ISOLATED SUPERCELLS /30-40 KT IN LOWEST 6 KM AGL/...AND INTENSIFYING LOW LEVEL JET SUGGESTS SEVERE THREAT MAY SPREAD NEWD INTO TONIGHT.
areas: WEST CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST NORTH DAKOTA

summary: DISCUSSION...TSTMS HAVE INCREASED IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OVER THE PAST HOUR IN RESPONSE TO A MOISTENING/DESTABILIZING BOUNDARY LAYER...AND STRENGTHENING BACKGROUND ASCENT IN NRN SEMI-CIRCLE OF ALEX.  GRADUALLY WEAKENING LOW-LEVEL SHEAR IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPENSATED BY DECREASING STABILITY TODAY WITH THE ENVIRONMENT REMAINING SUPPORTIVE OF SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...LIKE PREVIOUS DAYS...THUNDERSTORMS ARE BEGINNING TO DEVELOP OVER THE HIGH TERRAIN NEAR AND NE OF THE ID/SW MT BORDER. CONTINUED SURFACE HEATING ACROSS CENTRAL MT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ADDITIONAL DESTABILIZATION IN AN ENVIRONMENT WITH BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW-MID 50S.  THIS AREA IS ALSO DOWNSTREAM FROM A MIDLEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PAC NW...WITH A SUBTLE/EMBEDDED VORTICITY LOBE EJECTING NEWD OVER WRN MT.  THE COMBINATION OF WEAK BACKGROUND ASCENT AND DEEP-LAYER VERTICAL SHEAR WITH THIS EJECTING WAVE WILL SUPPORT A FEW SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ISOLATED VERY LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.  AN ISOLATED TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT...THOUGH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE/SHEAR ARE MARGINAL FOR A TORNADO THREAT.  OTHERWISE...CONVECTION MAY MERGE INTO LARGER CLUSTERS DURING THE EVENING AND SPREAD NEWD INTO NE MT WITH A CONTINUED DAMAGING WIND/HAIL THREAT.
areas: A SMALL PART OF EAST CENTRAL IDAHO

summary: DISCUSSION...BOWING MCS OVER ERN MT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE MOVING EWD 30-35 KT INTO AN INCREASINGLY MOIST AND UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE MID/UPPER 60S AND MLCAPE TO 2000 J/KG. ENELY LOW LEVEL WINDS COUPLED WITH SWLY MID LEVEL WINDS OF 30-40 KT ARE RESULTING IN DEEP LAYER SHEAR OF 35-40 KT SUPPORTIVE OF ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE STORMS INCLUDING ISOLATED SUPERCELLS AND BOWING LINE SEGMENTS.  THREAT FOR DAMAGING WIND GUSTS AND LARGE HAIL WILL CONTINUE FOR AT LEAST SEVERAL MORE HOURS TONIGHT.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT MOVES EAST ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST MT. VERY WARM AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL FOSTER ROBUST AND LONG-LIVED THUNDERSTORMS. GIVEN STRENGTHENING MID LEVEL FLOW OF UP TO 50KT...EXPECT STORMS TO BE WELL ORGANIZED AND INCLUDE SUPERCELLS...WITH THE PROSPECT OF LARGE HAIL...AS WELL AS LINE SEGMENTS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING LOCALLY DAMAGING WIND GUSTS. CONVECTION WAS ALREADY INITIATING ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST MT WHERE OROGRAPHIC AND FRONTAL LIFT HAVE OVERCOME INHIBITION. EXPECT ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT NEXT FEW HOURS AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO CENTRAL MT. DRIER AIRMASS EMANATING FROM WY...MAY INHIBIT DEVELOPMENT ACROSS SOUTH-CENTRAL MT. HOWEVER...ANY STORMS MOVING ACROSS THIS AREA LATER WILL POSE SOME THREAT FOR DAMAGING WINDS GIVEN DEEPLY MIXED AND HOT BOUNDARY LAYER AIRMASS EXPECTED. ADDITIONAL...PERHAPS LINEAR DEVELOPMENT...MAY OCCUR LATER TODAY AND INTO TONIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO NERN MT. SOME GUIDANCE SUGGESTS STORM MAY ACTUALLY FORM IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE FRONTAL WIND SHIFT. NONETHELESS...THIS ACTIVITY COULD STILL PRODUCE HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS IN THESE AREAS THROUGH THE EVENING.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE INCREASING IN NUMBER/INTENSITY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SERN WY.  WITH GREATER INSTABILITY TO THE E ACROSS THE WATCH AREA COUPLED WITH CONTINUED HEATING...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE LIKELY TO DEVELOPS EWD WITH POTENTIAL FOR SUPERCELLS. LARGE HAIL WILL BE THE PRIMARY THREAT INITIALLY...PARTICULARLY WITH SUPERCELLS. HOWEVER STEEP LAPSE RATES AND RELATIVELY HIGH BASES WILL LEAD TO DAMAGING WIND POTENTIAL.

DISCUSSION...SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST TOWARD ERN ND AND WRN MN OVERNIGHT. AIRMASS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT AND PRE-FRONTAL SURFACE TROUGH IS VERY WARM AND UNSTABLE WITH MLCAPE AROUND 3000 J/KG IN SOME LOCATIONS. THIS INSTABILITY SHOULD CONTRIBUTE TO ROBUST TSTM DEVELOPMENT OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS. STORM DEVELOPMENT HAS BEEN LIMITED SO FAR TODAY BY WARM TEMPERATURES ALOFT/CAPPING...AND WEAK FORCING ALONG THE FRONT. HOWEVER...RECENT INDICATIONS IN OBJECTIVE DATA AND MODEL GUIDANCE SUGGEST THAT CAP HAS WEAKENED AND STORMS SHOULD INITIATE WITHIN THE WATCH AREA AS THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH DEVELOP EWD TONIGHT. EFFECTIVE BULK SHEAR IS ON THE ORDER OF 30KT AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT ORGANIZED STORMS/SUPERCELLS WITH THREATS OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...INTENSE COMPLEX OF STORMS NEAR THE SD/NEB BORDER...EAST OF CDR... ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE/SPREAD ENEWD ACROSS PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EVENTUALLY ERN SD LATER THIS EVENING. THIS COMPLEX OF STORMS IS EXPECTED TO EVOLVE INTO A LINEAR SYSTEM...WITH WIND DAMAGE THE MAIN THREAT. ALSO...WITH THE COLD FRONT IN THE AREA AND UPPER IMPULSE APPROACHING FROM THE WEST...OTHER STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP. THE WARM AND VERY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR THESE STORMS TO PRODUCE WIND DAMAGE AND HAIL.

DISCUSSION...VEERING SHEAR PROFILES...STEEP LAPSE RATES COUPLED WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE/INSTABILITY FAVOR DEVELOPMENT OF SUPERCELLS OFF THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  WITH AP ROACH OF MID LEVEL TROUGH FROM UTAH...THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP EWD AND SEWD ACROSS SERN WY INTO NERN CO THRU THE AFTERNOON.  LARGE HAIL AND ISOLATED TORNADOES WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH SUPERCELLS THAT DEVELOP.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS EVENING IN ADVANCE OF MIDLEVEL TROUGH APPROACHING THE CNTRL ROCKIES.  REGION RESIDES ALONG THE SRN PERIPHERY OF STRONGER MID AND HIGH-LEVEL WIND FIELD ATTENDANT TO THIS TROUGH WITH GENERALLY 30-35 KT OF EFFECTIVE BULK SHEAR.  WHEN COUPLED WITH A MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS...ENVIRONMENT WILL SUPPORT ORGANIZED STORMS...INCLUDING SUPERCELLS AND BOWS WITH THE PRIMARY HAZARDS BEING SEVERE HAIL AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

DISCUSSION...A RATHER FOCUSED AREA OF CONCERN FOR SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT IS ACROSS SCENTRAL SD WHERE BOTH SHEAR AND INSTABILITY ARE MAXIMIZED.  THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO FORM QUICKLY WRN PORTION OF WATCH AREA WHERE SURFACE CONVERGENCE IS GREATEST AND QUICKLY BECOME SEVERE.  STORMS WILL LIKELY BECOME SUPERCELLS WITH POTENTIAL FOR LARGE HAIL AND AT LEAST AN ISOLATED TORNADO AS THEY MOVE EWD ACROSS THE WATCH AREA.

summary: DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE DEVELOPING ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT EXTENDS FROM CHERRY COUNTY TO CYS.  IN ADDITION STORMS WILL DEVELOP EWD OFF THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF NERN CO/SERN WY.  WITH MLCAPES AOA 1000 J/KG...STEEP LAPSE RATES AND 30-35 KT OF SHEAR...SEVERE STORMS ARE LIKELY...INCLUDING LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS.  ISOLATED SUPERCELLS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE INCREASING BOTH HAIL AND WIND THREAT AS WELL AS POSSIBLE BRIEF TORNADO'S/LAND SPOUTS.

summary: DISCUSSION...STRONG DAYTIME HEATING AND THE INCREASING INFLUENCE OF MIDLEVEL TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE W ARE EXPECTED TO FOSTER ISOLATED TO SCATTERED TSTM DEVELOPMENT ALONG LEE TROUGH WITHIN THE NEXT ONE TO TWO HOURS.  AMBIENT AIR MASS E OF LEE TROUGH IS ALREADY MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH MLCAPE OF 1000-2000 J/KG...WITH FURTHER DESTABILIZATION ANTICIPATED THROUGH LATE AFTERNOON. THE COMBINATION OF EFFECTIVE SRH OF 300-400 M2/S2...MLCAPE OF 500-1000 J/KG AND THE POTENTIAL FOR MORE DISCRETE STORM MODES SUGGEST A THREAT LONG-TRACKED SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF STRONG TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...STRONG DEEP-LAYER FORCING FOR ASCENT COUPLED WITH EXTREMELY STRONG WIND FIELD ARE EXPECTED TO SUPPORT THE CONTINUATION OF SMALL BOWING AND SUPERCELL STRUCTURES DESPITE THE MARGINAL INSTABILITY.  WHILE DAMAGING WIND GUSTS WILL BE THE PRIMARY HAZARD...A TORNADO OR TWO WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY PERSISTENT...ROTATING STORMS.

DISCUSSION...CLEARING IN THE WAKE OF GRAVITY WAVE AND AHEAD OF COLD FRONT HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE LOW/MID 80S.  AND WHILE MIDLEVEL LAPSE RATES ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN POOR...THE BOUNDARY LAYER WARMING COUPLED WITH DEW POINTS IN THE UPPER 60S TO AROUND 70 F ARE EXPECTED TO YIELD A MODERATELY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT THIS AFTERNOON WITH MLCAPE INCREASING TO 1000-2000 J/KG.  WHEN COUPLED WITH RELATIVELY STRONG LOW AND DEEP-LAYER SHEAR...SETUP WILL FAVOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF A FEW TORNADOES IN ADDITION TO LOCALLY DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

DISCUSSION...LONG-LIVED QLCS WITH A HISTORY OF WIDESPREAD WIND DAMAGE AND A FEW TORNADOES IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE EWD THROUGH THE UPPER OH VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON INTO EVENING. BOUNDARY LAYER AHEAD OF CONVECTIVE SYSTEM IS WARMING/MOISTENING... SUPPORTING A NARROW AXIS OF MARGINAL...BUT SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY. GIVEN THE VERY STRONG LOW AND DEEP-LAYER SHEAR IN PLACE... ENVIRONMENT WILL REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR EMBEDDED BOWS AND SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF DAMAGING WINDS AND A FEW TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON ALONG AND IN THE WAKE OF GRAVITY WAVE PROPAGATING SEWD THROUGH THE AREA.  AMBIENT AIR MASS CONTINUES TO WARM/DESTABILIZE WITH MLCAPE VALUES NOW AROUND 500-1000 J/KG.  GIVEN THE STRONG LOW AND DEEP-LAYER SHEAR IN PLACE...ENVIRONMENT WILL BE SUPPORTIVE OF SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF DAMAGING WINDS AND A FEW TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...BANDS OF TSTMS ARE GRADUALLY INTENSIFYING THIS AFTERNOON WITHIN A WARM...MOIST AIR MASS WITH MLCAPE OF 1000-1500 J/KG.  LOW-LEVEL WIND FILED IS GRADUALLY VEERING...THOUGH SUFFICIENT LOW AND DEEP-LAYER SHEAR STILL EXISTS FOR SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF TORNADOES AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

DISCUSSION...SCATTERED SEVERE STORMS WILL CONTINUE IN A LOOSE BAND FROM SC NEWD INTO WRN NC AND WRN VA THIS EVENING...IN AN ENVIRONMENT FAVORING SUPERCELLS WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR A FEW TORNADOES.  FARTHER N AND LATER...A BAND OF ASCENT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SQUALL LINE WHICH WEAKENED OVER THE APPALACHIANS WILL ENCOUNTER A MORE MOIST/UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT ACROSS VA/MD.  HERE...STRONG VERTICAL SHEAR COULD SUPPORT THE FORMATION OF ADDITIONAL BOWING SEGMENTS AND EMBEDDED SUPERCELLS...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING WINDS AND A COUPLE OF TORNADOES TONIGHT.

DISCUSSION...QUASI-STATIONARY BAND OF TRAINING STORMS WILL LIKELY PERSIST FOR SEVERAL MORE HOURS AS THE SYNOPTIC FRONT STALLS WITH DEEP-LAYER FLOW PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY.  DESPITE THE LOSS OF SURFACE HEATING...BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S AND A CONTINUATION OF A 40 KT SWLY LLJ WILL MAINTAIN SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY AND LOW-LEVEL SHEAR FOR AN EMBEDDED SUPERCELL AND TORNADO THREAT.

summary: DISCUSSION...AXIS OF LOW LVL CONFLUENCE EXTENDING FROM N GA ENE INTO S CNTRL VA EXPECTED TO REMAIN A FOCUS FOR LOW LVL UPLIFT THROUGH LATER THIS MORNING.  WHILE DEEP FORCING FOR ASCENT WILL REMAIN WEAK OR NEUTRAL...UPLIFT ALONG THE CONFLUENCE AXIS...PRESENCE OF EXISTING STORMS/SHOWERS...SEASONABLY RICH LOW LVL MOISTURE...AND MODERATE TO STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILES SUGGEST A CONTINUED THREAT FOR OCCASIONAL STORMS WITH LOW LVL ROTATION AND POSSIBLY ISOLD TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS HAVE INCREASED IN THE PAST HOUR OR SO ALONG PREFRONTAL CONFLUENCE ZONE IN CNTRL AL/NRN G /REF MCD 2016/...POSSIBLY REFLECTING INCREASED ASCENT ASSOCIATED WITH APPARENT UPR IMPULSE OVER REGION.  STRENGTH OF WIND FIELD...SOMEWHAT CURVED LOW-LVL HODOGRAPHS INVOF CONFLUENCE AND ALONG STNRY FRONT FARTHER N...AND LOW LCLS SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR A FEW STORMS WITH LOW-LVL ROTATION/POSSIBLE TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS DEVELOPING ALONG SURFACE FRONT OVER N-CNTRL VA ARE EXPECTED TO EXPAND IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON AS WARM SECTOR AIR MASS CONTINUES TO DESTABILIZE.  REGIONAL VWP DATA INDICATE THE PRESENCE OF MODERATELY STRONG LOW AND DEEP LAYER-SHEAR WHICH SHOULD PERSIST THROUGH THE DIURNAL HEATING CYCLE OWING TO THE PRESENCE OF A 40 KT SWLY LLJ.  AS SUCH...SETUP WILL FAVOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF ORGANIZED STORMS INCLUDING SUPERCELLS AND BOWING STRUCTURES WITH A RISK FOR DAMAGING WINDS AND A FEW TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...AN UPSWING IN TSTM ACTIVITY IS ANTICIPATED THIS AFTERNOON ALONG AND S/SE OF SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY WITHIN A WARM...HUMID AIR MASS WHERE MLCAPE WILL APPROACH 1000-1500 J/KG.  REGION WILL REMAIN ALONG SERN PERIPHERY OF STRONGEST CYCLONIC MID AND HIGH-LEVEL FLOW WITH SUFFICIENT /35-45 KT/ DEEP-LAYER SHEAR TO SUPPORT SUPERCELLS.  STEEPENING LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES...A CORRIDOR OF LOCALLY HIGHER VORTICITY INVOF FRONT AND MAINTENANCE OF SWRN EXTENSION OF SWLY 30-40 KT LLJ ACROSS AREA INDICATE A RISK FOR A COUPLE OF TORNADOES IN ADDITION TO LOCALLY DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS DEVELOPING ALONG SW-NE ORIENTED SURFACE BAROCLINIC ZONE ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON WITHIN A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS WITH MLCAPE VALUES OF 1000-1500 J/KG.  A 40 KT SWLY LLJ WILL BE MAINTAINED ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY...WHICH WHEN COUPLED WITH 50-55 KT SWLY MIDLEVEL WIND FIELD...IS RESULTING IN A SUFFICIENTLY SHEARED KINEMATIC ENVIRONMENT FOR SUPERCELLS AND BOWING STRUCTURES CAPABLE OF DAMAGING WINDS AND A COUPLE OF TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS CONTINUE MOVING ENEWD OVER SOUTHEAST VA...WITH ADDITIONAL STORMS INCREASING IN A LINE FROM EXTENDING SWWD OVER SOUTH CENTRAL VA.  AIR MASS REMAINS MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITHIN AN ENVIRONMENT CHARACTERIZED BY 35-45 KT DEEP LAYER SHEAR...WHICH WILL MAINTAIN THREAT FOR SUPERCELL STRUCTURES. A SSWLY LOW LEVEL JET IS FORECAST TO INTENSIFY THIS EVENING INCREASING LOW LEVEL SHEAR AND SRH WITH CONTINUED THREAT FOR A FEW TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS MOVING INTO CENTRAL PARTS OF THE CAROLINAS ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST INTO TONIGHT AS THEY MOVE INTO MOIST AND UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT. THEY ARE OCCURRING ALONG SRN EDGE OF STRONGER MID/UPPER FLOW ASSOCIATED WITH THE INTENSE UPPER LOW NORTH OF LAKE SUPERIOR. DEEP LAYER SHEAR OVER THE AREA REMAINS FAVORABLE FOR SUPERCELLS...AND A STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE LOW LEVEL SHEAR AND SRH /SEE CURRENT KCAE VWP/.  THIS WILL MAINTAIN A THREAT FOR SEVERE STORMS AND A FEW TORNADOES INTO TONIGHT.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THROUGH EARLY TUE OVER PARTS OF ERN/SE TX AND WRN LA AS LOW LVL WAA/MOISTURE INFLOW STRENGTHEN DOWNSTREAM FROM AMPLIFYING W TX UPR TROUGH.  WEAK MID LVL FLOW SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE AND BACK. COUPLED WITH EXISTING LOW LVL FORCING MECHANISMS /MAINLY THE SSW-NNE BOUNDARY FROM W OF KHGX TO NEAR KSHV/...SETUP SHOULD FAVOR BROKEN LINE SEGMENTS/SMALL CLUSTERS OF MULTICELLS AND POSSIBLY MARGINAL SUPERCELLS WITH SVR HAIL/LOCALLY DMGG WIND.  LOCALLY ENHANCED LOW LVL SPEED/DIRECTIONAL SHEAR NEAR MCS OUTFLOW BNDRY IN THE KHGX/KGLS AREA...AND RICH MOISTURE...SUGGEST A NON-ZERO TORNADO THREAT ACROSS THAT REGION.  THIS THREAT...HOWEVER...APPEARS TOO LOW TO WARRANT A SEPARATE TORNADO WATCH ATTM.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS NOW FORMING ALONG WRN EXTENSION OF LOW LVL CONFLUENCE ZONE ASSOCIATED WITH ERN AND SE TX STORMS...AND ELEVATED STORMS FORMING ATOP SHALLOW FRONTAL IN THE TX HILL COUNTRY...EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND STRENGTH THROUGH EARLY TUE AS LARGE SCALE ASCENT/MID LVL COOLING SPREAD SEWD IN ASSOCIATION WITH AMPLIFYING W TX UPR VORT.  QUALITY OF LOW LVL MOISTURE...STEEPENING MID LVL LAPSE RATES...AND STRENGTHENING OF MID/UPR LVL WIND FIELD TOGETHER SUGGEST SOME LIKELIHOOD FOR ROTATING STORMS AND BOWING SEGMENTS WITH SVR HAIL/WIND...DESPITE POTENTIAL FOR DESTRUCTIVE INTERFERENCE OF STORMS.  ACTIVITY SHOULD MERGE INTO ONE OR TWO COMPLEX MCSS THAT MOVE MAINLY SE TO THE CNTRL/LWR TX GULF CST LATER IN THE WATCH PERIOD.

DISCUSSION...QLCS OVER THE SHELF WATERS OF THE N-CNTRL GULF OF MEXICO IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE NEWD THIS MORNING...AFFECTING PORTIONS OF THE FL PNHDL.  LATEST TRENDS IN AREA VWP DATA AND SHORT TERM MODEL GUIDANCE INDICATE THAT LLJ WILL CONTINUE TO UNDERGO MARKED INTENSIFICATION THROUGH MID MORNING...EFFECTIVELY ENHANCING THE NWD FLUX OF AN INCREASINGLY MOIST AND UNSTABLE BOUNDARY LAYER ONSHORE.  GIVEN THE STRENGTHENING VERTICAL SHEAR...BOWING AND SUPERCELL STRUCTURES WILL BE POSSIBLE WITHIN QLCS...WITH A THREAT FOR DOWNSTREAM DEVELOPMENT OF MORE DISCRETE SUPERCELLS.  DAMAGING WIND GUSTS AND A COUPLE OF TORNADOES WILL BE POSSIBLE AS ACTIVITY PROGRESSES ACROSS WW AREA.

DISCUSSION...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE INCREASING ALONG/AHEAD OF SURFACE COLD FRONT OVER WESTERN VA/NC/SC.  THESE STORMS WILL TRACK NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE WATCH AREA THROUGH MUCH OF THE NIGHT AS A STRONG UPPER TROUGH ROTATES INTO REGION.  VERY STRONG WIND FIELDS WILL OFFSET WEAK INSTABILITY FOR A RISK OF A FEW SEVERE STORMS. DAMAGING WINDS ARE THE PRIMARY THREAT.  HOWEVER...SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL VERTICAL SHEAR IS PRESENT FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED TORNADOES AS WELL.

DISCUSSION...INCREASING LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER VA/MD/CENTRAL PA WILL TRACK RAPIDLY EASTWARD DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS.  INSTABILITY IS VERY WEAK...BUT APPEARS SUFFICIENT FOR THE RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS ALONG THE LEADING EDGE OF THE CONVECTION.

DISCUSSION...QLCS WITH EMBEDDED BOWING STRUCTURES IS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS WW AREA EARLY THIS MORNING AT 40-45 KT.  GIVEN THE VERY STRONG AMBIENT WIND FIELD IN PLACE...POTENTIAL WILL EXIST FOR CORRIDORS OF DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN NUMBER AND INTENSITY ALONG AND AHEAD OF STRONG COLD FROM ERN IA INTO NRN MO. AIR MASS IS NOW MODESTLY UNSTABLE AND WITH THE VERY STRONG SHEAR PROFILES IN PLACE...SEVERE STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP.  PRIMARY THREAT WILL BE WIND DAMAGE...HOWEVER SUPERCELLS INCLUDING POSSIBLE TORNADOES WILL BE POSSIBLE...PRIMARILY IN ADVANCE OF DEEPENING LOW MOVING NEWD ACROSS ERN IA INTO WI AND EWD NEAR WARM FRONT ACROSS NRN IL.

VERY STRONG DEEP WIND FIELD...SEASONABLY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER INFLOW...AND RELATIVELY STEEP LOW LVL LAPSE RATES SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR A FEW SEMI-DISCRETE SUPERCELLS POSING A THREAT FOR TORNADOES...IN ADDITION TO SVR HAIL/WIND.

WHILE LOW LVL BUOYANCY WILL DIMINISH WITH NIGHTFALL...STRENGTH OF BOTH LOW-LVL AND DEEP SHEAR SUGGESTS POSSIBILITY FOR SUPERCELLS AND EVEN A COUPLE TORNADOES AS THE STORMS EVOLVE INTO BROKEN LINE SEGMENTS/LEWPS.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS EXPECTED TO PERSIST ALONG SE-MOVING COLD FRONT NOW MOVING INTO NW AR.  CONVECTION ALSO EXPECTED TO DEEPEN AND INCREASE IN COVERAGE ALONG PREFRONTAL CONFLUENCE ZONE/WAA AXIS IN CNTRL/NE AR. STRONG...VEERING LOW TO MID-LVL WIND PROFILES...AMPLE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE...AND RESIDUAL EML TOGETHER SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR SUPERCELLS WITH SVR WIND/MARGINALLY SVR HAIL...AND POSSIBLY A COUPLE TORNADOES...THROUGH EARLY TUE.

DISCUSSION...SHOWERS/TSTMS FORMING ALONG SW-NE PREFRONTAL CONFLUENCE ZONE...AND STORMS ALONG FRONTAL BAND FARTHER NW...EXPECTED TO PERSIST AND POSSIBLY INCREASE THROUGH EARLY TUE AS REGION IS GLANCED BY SHORTWAVE IMPULSE NOW CROSSING KS.  STRONG WIND FIELD WITH SUBSTANTIAL LOW-LVL DIRECTIONAL SHEAR...AND CONTINUED LOW-LL MOISTURE INFLOW NNEWD THROUGH THE MS VLY...SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR A FEW SUSTAINED STORMS/SUPERCELLS.  THESE COULD YIELD MARGINALLY SVR HAIL...LOCALLY DMGG WIND...AND /MAINLY WITH PRE-FRONTAL ACTIVITY/...A COUPLE TORNADOES.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO INCREASE IN NUMBER AND INTENSITY ACROSS THE WATCH AREA AS NWD MOVING WARM FRONT HAS ALLOWED AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MDTLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS TO FLOW INTO AREA. VERY STRONG SHEAR PROFILES IN PLACE AND WITH CINH NEARLY GONE...STRONG UPDRAFTS COULD DEVELOP INTO SUPERCELLS THRU THE AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING. IN ADDITION TO DAMAGING WINDS...TORNADOES WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY SUPERCELL THAT FORMS.

DISCUSSION...A BAND OF OCCASIONALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL PERSIST OVERNIGHT ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM NE OK INTO SRN MO.  WEAK SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY AND STRONG VERTICAL SHEAR WILL REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR EMBEDDED SUPERCELLS WITH AN ATTENDANT RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS AND A COUPLE OF TORNADOES.  CONVECTION SHOULD GRADUALLY BECOME MORE LINEAR LATER TONIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT OVERTAKES THE PRE-FRONTAL BAND.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS ARE INCREASING ALONG AND AHEAD OF STRONG COLD FRONT.  WHILE AIR MASS ONLY MARGINALLY UNSTABLE BUT VERY MOIST...THE STRONG WIND PROFILES WILL SUPPORT A FEW SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS BOTH EMBEDDED IN THE LINE ALONG FRONT AND POSSIBLY MORE DISCRETE STORMS IN WARM SECTOR.  PRIMARY THREAT WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS...HOWEVER THERE IS POTENTIAL OF BRIEF ROTATING STORMS AND ISOLATED TORNADOES WITHIN ANY STORM THAT CAN DEVELOP IN WARM SECTOR.

DISCUSSION...TSTMS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON INTO EVENING ALONG PACIFIC FRONT AND SW-NE ORIENTED CONFLUENCE BAND WHICH ARE SLOWLY PROGRESSING EWD THROUGH ERN TX.  18Z SUPPLEMENTAL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT MOISTENING AND WARMING OF THE BOUNDARY LAYER HAVE GREATLY REDUCED THE PRONOUNCED CAP OBSERVED AT 12Z.  GIVEN THE RELATIVELY STRONG LOW AND DEEP-LAYER SHEAR IN PLACE...ENVIRONMENT WILL BE SUPPORTIVE OF SUPERCELLS CAPABLE OF TORNADOES...DAMAGING WINDS AND SOME HAIL.  THIS THREAT SHOULD DEVELOP NEWD THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT ALONG RETREATING WARM FRONT AND SECONDARY SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING THROUGH ERN AR/WRN MS.

DISCUSSION...SCATTERED WARM SECTOR CONVECTION WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE EVENING FROM SE LA NNEWD INTO CENTRAL MS.  AS THESE STORMS SLOWLY DEEPEN WITH INCREASING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE...THE POTENTIAL WILL LIKEWISE INCREASE FOR STRENGTHENING STORM ROTATION AND AN ATTENDANT RISK FOR A COUPLE OF TORNADOES.  THE MOST PROBABLE TORNADO THREAT AREA WILL BE AS STORM INTERACT WITH THE NWD MOVING WARM FRONT IN MS...WHERE LOW-LEVEL SHEAR IS STRONGEST.

DISCUSSION...PRE-FRONTAL BAND OF SEVERE STORMS...WITH EMBEDDED SUPERCELLS...WILL PERSIST INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS FROM SW/CENTRAL LA NEWD ACROSS CENTRAL MS.  THE ENVIRONMENT REMAINS SUFFICIENTLY UNSTABLE FOR SURFACE-BASED STORMS...AND LOW-LEVEL SHEAR IS MAXIMIZED NEAR A WARM FRONT MOVING NWD/NEWD ACROSS CENTRAL MS.  THE THREAT FOR TORNADOES WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT WITH STORMS IN THE PRIMARY BAND...AND WITH ADDITIONAL MORE ISOLATED DEVELOPMENT IN THE OPEN WARM SECTOR WHERE CONVECTIVE INHIBITION IS WEAK.

DISCUSSION...BAND OF THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS CENTRAL/NE MS WILL SPREAD EWD/NEWD ACROSS WRN AND NRN AL THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  THE LOW LEVELS WILL CONTINUE TO WARM/MOISTEN NWD ACROSS AL AS THE WARM FRONT PROGRESSES NWD...ALLOWING INSTABILITY TO BE BASED NEAR THE SURFACE. THE NEAR SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY AND VERY STRONG LOW-LEVEL SHEAR WILL SUPPORT A RISK OF A FEW TORNADOES AND DAMAGING GUSTS WITH EMBEDDED SUPERCELL OR LEWP STRUCTURES THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.

DISCUSSION...SRN PART OF SW-NE LA/MS/AL QLCS EXPECTED ACCELERATE EWD LATER THIS MORNING AS TX UPR IMPULSE CONTINUES EWD...WHILE NRN PART MOVES ONLY VERY SLOWLY E ACROSS CNTRL/NRN AL.  AMPLE WIND FIELD WILL EXIST THROUGHOUT WW TO SUPPORT SUSTAINED STORMS/SUPERCELLS...AND VERY RICH MOISTURE WILL REMAIN AHEAD OF CONVECTIVE SYSTEM OVER SE LA/SRN MS/SRN AL.  BUT STRONGEST LOW LVL SHEAR WILL EXIST INVOF WEAK WARM FRONT OVER CNTRL/NRN AL...WHERE LOW LVL MOISTURE RETURN WILL CONTINUE.  THUS...SVR THREAT IN THE FORM OF SPORADIC DMGG WIND GUSTS AND ISOLD TORNADOES EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH LATER THIS MORNING...ESPECIALLY FROM E CNTRL/SE MS NEWD INTO CNTRL/NRN AL.
